intro: Androsace taurica, commonly known as the Caucasian rock jasmine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually basal, rosette-like, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Androsace taurica thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
